label: 部
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: a specialized worker community that served the Yamato Great King, members of the royal family, or a noble family (uji) up to ritsuryô times. A be was typically overseen by a hereditary royal vassal (tomo no miyatsuko) who was in turn subject to a courtier possessing the noble title (kabane) of muraji. [氏] [律令] [伴造] [姓] [連]
